description.zh-cn: 清末民初政治家，武昌起义后担任湖北军政府都督，后两度担任中华民国大总统。
description.en: A politician in the late Qing dynasty and early Republic of China. He served as the military governor of Hubei after the Wuchang Uprising and later served twice as the President of the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 清末民初的军事家、政治家，曾任中华民国临时大总统、首任正式大总统，后建立中华帝国但迅速失败。
description.en: A military and political figure in the late Qing dynasty and early Republic of China, who served as the Provisional President and the first formal President of the Republic of China, and later established the short-lived Empire of China.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国政治家，直系军阀首领，曾代理中华民国大总统。
description.en: A politician of the Republic of China, leader of the Zhili clique, who served as acting President of the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国政治家，曾任中华民国大总统。
description.en: A politician of the Republic of China who served as the President of the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国政治家，皖系军阀首领，曾多次担任国务总理。
description.en: A politician of the Republic of China, leader of the Anhui clique, who served multiple times as Premier.

description.zh-cn: 清末民初军阀，曾于1917年发动旨在恢复清朝帝制的政变。
description.en: A warlord in the late Qing dynasty and early Republic of China, known for launching a coup in 1917 to restore the Qing monarchy.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国直系军阀首领，曾通过贿选当选大总统。
description.en: A leader of the Zhili clique in the Republic of China, who became President through bribery.

description.zh-cn: 中国近代民主革命的伟大先行者，中华民国与中国国民党的缔造者，首任中华民国临时大总统。
description.en: A great pioneer of China's modern democratic revolution, the founder of the Republic of China and the Kuomintang, and the first Provisional President of the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 中国近代启蒙思想家、翻译家、教育家，曾在北洋水师学堂任教。
description.en: A modern Chinese enlightenment thinker, translator, and educator, who taught at the Beiyang Naval Academy.

description.zh-cn: 黎元洪的妻子。
description.en: Wife of Li Yuanhong.

description.zh-cn: 黎元洪的次女，嫁给袁世凯之子袁克玖。
description.en: The second daughter of Li Yuanhong, married to Yuan Kejiu, son of Yuan Shikai.

description.zh-cn: 袁世凯的第九子，娶黎元洪之女黎绍芳为妻。
description.en: The ninth son of Yuan Shikai, married to Li Shaofang, daughter of Li Yuanhong.

description.zh-cn: 清朝最后一位皇帝，也是中国历史上最后一位皇帝。
description.en: The last emperor of the Qing dynasty and the last emperor in Chinese history.

en: President of the Republic of China

description.zh-cn: 中华民国（1912年—1949年）的国家元首职位。
description.en: The head of state position of the Republic of China (1912–1949).

en: Vice President of the Republic of China

description.zh-cn: 中华民国的国家副元首职位。
description.en: The deputy head of state position of the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 辛亥革命武昌起义后在湖北省成立的军政府，是中国历史上第一个省级革命政权。
description.en: The military government established in Hubei Province after the Wuchang Uprising of the 1911 Revolution. It was the first provincial revolutionary regime in Chinese history.

description.zh-cn: 清末由李鸿章创办的近代海军学校，旨在为北洋水师培养海军人才。
description.en: A modern naval academy founded by Li Hongzhang in the late Qing dynasty to train naval personnel for the Beiyang Fleet.

description.zh-cn: 清朝后期建立的四支近代海军中实力最强、规模最大的一支。
description.en: The most powerful and largest of the four modern navies established in the late Qing dynasty.

description.zh-cn: 清末民初的一支重要军事政治力量，由袁世凯建立并发展壮大。
description.en: An important military and political force in the late Qing dynasty and early Republic of China, established and expanded by Yuan Shikai.

description.zh-cn: 1917年由段祺瑞组织的，旨在讨伐张勋复辟的军队。
description.en: An army organized by Duan Qirui in 1917 to suppress the restoration attempt by Zhang Xun.

description.zh-cn: 1911年10月10日在中国武昌发生的一场旨在推翻清朝的兵变，是辛亥革命的开端。
description.en: A mutiny that occurred in Wuchang, China, on October 10, 1911, aimed at overthrowing the Qing dynasty, marking the beginning of the Xinhai Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 1917年中华民国大总统府与国务院之间围绕是否参与第一次世界大战对德宣战而产生的权力斗争，主要人物为总统黎元洪和总理段祺瑞。
description.en: A power struggle in 1917 between the Presidential Palace (Fu) and the State Council (Yuan) of the Republic of China over whether to declare war on Germany during World War I. The main figures were President Li Yuanhong and Premier Duan Qirui.

description.zh-cn: 1917年由军阀张勋发动的、旨在恢复清朝统治的短暂政变，拥立已退位的皇帝溥仪复辟。
description.en: A short-lived coup launched by warlord Zhang Xun in 1917 to restore the Qing dynasty, reinstalling the abdicated emperor Puyi.

description.zh-cn: 民国军阀时期直系军阀和奉系军阀为争夺北京政府控制权而进行的战争。第一次直奉战争后，大总统徐世昌被驱逐。
description.en: Wars fought between the Zhili and Fengtian cliques for control of the Beiyang government during the Warlord Era. After the First Zhili–Fengtian War, President Xu Shichang was ousted.

description.zh-cn: 黎元洪出生于湖北省汉阳府黄陂县。
description.en: Li Yuanhong was born in Huangpi County, Hanyang Prefecture, Hubei Province.

description.zh-cn: 1883年考入天津北洋水师学堂，1888年毕业。
description.en: He was admitted to the Beiyang Naval Academy in Tianjin in 1883 and graduated in 1888.

description.zh-cn: 毕业后在广东水师广甲号任职，甲午战争时所在舰船被击沉。
description.en: After graduation, he served on the Guangjia in the Guangdong Fleet. His ship was sunk during the First Sino-Japanese War.

description.zh-cn: 甲午战争后投靠张之洞督练新军，在清末新军和民国北洋陆军中长期服役。
description.en: After the First Sino-Japanese War, he joined Zhang Zhidong to train the New Army, serving long-term in the late Qing New Army and the Beiyang Army of the Republic.

description.zh-cn: 黎元洪在北洋水师学堂就读时，严复是其师长，并评价其“德高才疏”。
description.en: When Li Yuanhong studied at the Beiyang Naval Academy, Yan Fu was his teacher and commented that he was 'of high moral character but limited talent'.

description.zh-cn: 武昌起义爆发后，革命党人因军中无主，拥立时任协统的黎元洪出任湖北军政府都督。
description.en: After the Wuchang Uprising broke out, with no leader in their ranks, the revolutionaries endorsed Li Yuanhong, then a brigade commander, to be the military governor of the Hubei Military Government.

description.zh-cn: 南京临时政府成立后被选为临时副总统，1913年10月正式当选副总统。
description.en: He was elected Provisional Vice President after the establishment of the Nanjing Provisional Government, and formally elected Vice President in October 1913.

description.zh-cn: 在孙中山担任临时大总统期间，黎元洪任临时副总统。
description.en: Li Yuanhong served as Provisional Vice President while Sun Yat-sen was the Provisional President.

description.zh-cn: 在袁世凯担任大总统期间，黎元洪任副总统。
description.en: Li Yuanhong served as Vice President while Yuan Shikai was President.

description.zh-cn: 1913年12月，黎元洪被段祺瑞等人胁迫进入北京，并被袁世凯迁入瀛台居住，实际上是加以软禁。
description.en: In December 1913, Li Yuanhong was coerced into Beijing by Duan Qirui and others and was moved into the Yingtai by Yuan Shikai, effectively placing him under house arrest.

description.zh-cn: 黎元洪曾两次担任中华民国大总统。第一次是在袁世凯死后继任，第二次是在直奉战争后复任。
description.en: Li Yuanhong served as President of the Republic of China twice. The first time was succeeding Yuan Shikai after his death, and the second time was resuming office after the First Zhili-Fengtian War.

description.zh-cn: 因是否对德宣战问题爆发“府院之争”，黎元洪免去段祺瑞的总理职务，而段祺瑞则唆使各地督军独立以示对抗。
description.en: The 'Manor-Court Rivalry' erupted over the issue of declaring war on Germany. Li Yuanhong dismissed Duan Qirui from his post as Premier, and Duan in turn instigated military governors in various regions to declare independence in protest.

description.zh-cn: 张勋以调解府院之争为名率军入京，随即要求黎元洪解散国会，黎被迫同意。
description.en: Under the pretext of mediating the 'Manor-Court Rivalry', Zhang Xun led his troops into Beijing and immediately demanded that Li Yuanhong dissolve the parliament, which Li was forced to agree to.

description.zh-cn: 张勋拥立溥仪复辟后，黎元洪逃入东交民巷的日本公使馆寻求庇护，并通电去职，以此表示反对。
description.en: After Zhang Xun restored Puyi to the throne, Li Yuanhong fled to the Japanese legation in the Legation Quarter for asylum and announced his resignation by telegram to show his opposition.

description.zh-cn: 段祺瑞在天津组织讨逆军，讨伐张勋复辟。
description.en: Duan Qirui organized the Rebel-suppressing Army in Tianjin to crusade against Zhang Xun's restoration.

description.zh-cn: 段祺瑞率领的讨逆军攻入北京，迅速击败了张勋的军队，结束了复辟闹剧。
description.en: The Rebel-suppressing Army led by Duan Qirui attacked Beijing and quickly defeated Zhang Xun's forces, ending the restoration farce.

description.zh-cn: 第一次直奉战争后，直系军阀控制北京政府，大总统徐世昌被驱逐，黎元洪被拥立复任大总统。
description.en: After the First Zhili-Fengtian War, the Zhili clique controlled the Beijing government. President Xu Shichang was ousted, and Li Yuanhong was supported to resume the presidency.

description.zh-cn: 第一次直奉战争后，直系军阀控制北京政府，大总统徐世昌被迫下台。
description.en: After the First Zhili-Fengtian War, the Zhili clique took control of the Beijing government, forcing President Xu Shichang to step down.

description.zh-cn: 1923年6月，曹锟驱逐大总统黎元洪，随后通过贿选上台。
description.en: In June 1923, Cao Kun ousted President Li Yuanhong and subsequently came to power through bribery.

description.zh-cn: 黎绍芳是黎元洪的次女。
description.en: Li Shaofang is the second daughter of Li Yuanhong.

description.zh-cn: 袁克玖是袁世凯的第九子。
description.en: Yuan Kejiu is the ninth son of Yuan Shikai.

description.zh-cn: 张勋拥立已退位的清朝皇帝溥仪，宣布清朝复辟。
description.en: Zhang Xun enthroned the abdicated Qing Emperor Puyi, announcing the restoration of the Qing dynasty.
